title: Python Programming Fundamentals
description: Introduction to Python programming language, covering variables, data types, control structures, functions, and basic object-oriented programming concepts essential for data science.

title: Data Manipulation with Pandas
description: Comprehensive guide to using pandas library for data manipulation, including DataFrame operations, data cleaning, filtering, grouping, and merging datasets.

title: Numerical Computing with NumPy
description: Understanding NumPy arrays, mathematical operations, broadcasting, linear algebra operations, and numerical computations for scientific computing.

title: Data Visualization with Matplotlib and Seaborn
description: Creating effective data visualizations using matplotlib and seaborn libraries, including plots, charts, customization, and best practices for data presentation.

title: Jupyter Notebooks for Data Science
description: Using Jupyter notebooks for interactive data analysis, including markdown documentation, code organization, and sharing reproducible research.

title: Web Scraping and Data Collection
description: Techniques for collecting data from websites using requests, BeautifulSoup, and handling various data formats including HTML, JSON, and APIs.

title: Database Operations and SQL
description: Working with databases in Python, SQL query fundamentals, connecting to databases, and performing CRUD operations for data science projects.

title: Introduction to Machine Learning
description: Basic machine learning concepts, supervised and unsupervised learning, model evaluation, and using scikit-learn for common ML tasks.

title: Statistical Analysis for Data Science
description: Essential statistical concepts including descriptive statistics, probability distributions, hypothesis testing, and statistical inference using Python.

title: Version Control with Git
description: Using Git for version control in data science projects, collaboration workflows, branching strategies, and integrating with platforms like GitHub.
